definition: to give a false picture of the situation

sentences.english: Newspaper accounts of political and international affairs are often distorted.
sentences.chinese: 報紙上關於政治和國際時事的報道經常失實。

sentences.english: If there are inaccuracies in this book,the responsibility is mine.
sentences.chinese: 如果在這本書中有哪些地方失實，責任在我。

sentences.english: In the video, you will see that news coverage is not proportional.
sentences.chinese: 在這個視頻裏，你會看到新聞報道是失實的。

sentences.english: Discusses the reason of the inaccurate description of the Indian's image in this work.
sentences.chinese: 分析了慧超在該書中對印度人形象描寫失實的原因。

sentences.english: It became clear that the general had been badly misinformed.
sentences.chinese: 已經很清楚，將軍得到的情報是嚴重失實的。

sentences.english: I understand that I will not be eligible for this program if the information relating to this application is false.
sentences.chinese: 倘有失實，本人明白大會有權取消本人之申請資格。

sentences.english: Also of note in their own weeks, the book can not be prepared in other countries are often inaccurate.
sentences.chinese: 又各以其本國周悉，書別國並不能備，亦往往失實。

sentences.english: To amend the law relating to innocent misrepresentations.
sentences.chinese: 本條例旨在修訂有關無意的失實陳述的法例。

sentences.english: He gave a garbled account of the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 他對會議作了失實的報道。

sentences.english: Make sure it is a legitimate inaccuracy .
sentences.chinese: 確保它是一個合法的報道失實。

definition: to counter accusations/to protest/to remonstrate/to retort/to plead/to demur/a plea (of not guilty)/a defense (against an allegation)/to enter a plea to a charge (in a law court)
